intro: Atropis lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and distinctive inflorescence. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by a spathe, typical of the arum family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
